name: Tanner
ability: °EOA (end of age): draw 3 cards from the discard pile.  You may add one of them to demand.  Put the rest on the bottom of discards.
effect: Players providing the most science (not zero): Draw a card then discard.

name: Gatherer
ability: °When closed, you may return the contract to top of the demand pile.
effect: Players providing the most science (not zero): Draw a card then discard.

name: Wiseman
ability: °Your tax each age is 1g.
effect: Players providing the most science (not zero): Draw a card then discard.

name: Shoemaker
ability: °If the demand pile is at least twice the player count, this contract is worth 2.  Otherwise, 1.
effect: Players providing the most science (not zero): Draw a card then discard.

name: Fruit Monger
ability: °When closed, gain gold equal to the age.
effect: Players providing the most science (not zero): Draw a card then discard.

name: Baker
ability: °When opened: You may play an event as a free action.
effect: Players providing the most science (not zero): Draw a card then discard.

name: Skinner
ability: °No ability.
effect: Players providing the most science (not zero): Draw a card then discard.

effect: Players providing the most science (not zero): Draw a card then discard.

effect: Treasury -1 gold for each demand card in excess of contracted weapons.

name: Smuggler
ability: °When you play an event, place it face-down.
effect: Treasury -1 gold for each demand card in excess of contracted weapons.

ability: °On your turn, you may peek at one face-down business.
effect: Treasury -1 gold for each demand card in excess of contracted weapons.

ability: °You may discard a card as a free action.
effect: Treasury -1 gold for each demand card in excess of contracted weapons.

name: Warrior

effect: Treasury -1 gold for each demand card in excess of contracted weapons.

name: Trapper
ability: °If you resolve an event with food demand, gain 1 gold.
effect: Treasury -1 gold for each demand card in excess of contracted weapons.

name: Seamster
ability: °Your draw limit is increased by 1.
effect: Treasury -1 gold for each demand card in excess of contracted weapons.

name: Prophet
ability: °Once per turn, you may examine the top card of the draw deck.
effect: Treasury -1 gold for each demand card in excess of contracted weapons.

effect: Treasury -1 gold for each demand card in excess of contracted weapons.

ability: °When contracted, pay the contract from the treasury.  \n°Obsoleted by axes or swords.
effect: Treasury -1 gold for each demand card in excess of contracted weapons.

effect: May play directly to demand pile.  \nIf there’s no other food in the demand pile, +1 population.

ability: °When closed, pay another contract from the treasury.
effect: May play directly to demand pile.  \nIf there’s no other food in the demand pile, +1 population.

ability: °When contracted, pay the contract from the treasury.  \n°Obsoleted by axes or swords.
effect: May play directly to demand pile.  \nIf there’s no other food in the demand pile, +1 population.

name: Broker
ability: °When discarding development cards, you may pay 1 gold to add one to demand.
effect: May play directly to demand pile.  \nIf there’s no other food in the demand pile, +1 population.

name: Archivist
ability: °You may draw from the discard pile.  This ability ends after age III.
effect: May play directly to demand pile.  \nIf there’s no other food in the demand pile, +1 population.

name: Warrior
ability: °When contracted, pay the contract from the treasury.  \n°Obsoleted by axes or swords.
effect: May play directly to demand pile.  \nIf there’s no other food in the demand pile, +1 population.

ability: °After you play an event as your action, draw a card.
effect: May play directly to demand pile.  \nIf there’s no other food in the demand pile, +1 population.

name: Shaman
ability: °When you would resolve an event, you may choose not to.  It still goes to the demand pile.
effect: May play directly to demand pile.  \nIf there’s no other food in the demand pile, +1 population.

ability: °AAA (as an action): discard a card from your hand and gain 1 gold.
effect: May play directly to demand pile.  \nIf there’s no other food in the demand pile, +1 population.

ability: °EOA (end of age): look at the top card of the draw pile.  If it demands happiness, play it as an event.
effect: May play directly to demand pile.  \nIf there’s no other food in the demand pile, +1 population.

name: Alchemist
ability: °When drawing at the end of your turn, you may draw from age I.
effect: Players providing hides pay 1 unpaid contract from the treasury.

name: Bard
ability: °EOA (end of age): gain 1 gold for each other happiness you provide.
effect: Players providing hides pay 1 unpaid contract from the treasury.

name: Cook
ability: °If a business qualifies for a contract, you may place it on another business that provides as many resources.
effect: Players providing hides pay 1 unpaid contract from the treasury.

ability: °When contracted, pay the contract from the treasury.  \n°Obsoleted by axes or swords.

effect: Players providing hides pay 1 unpaid contract from the treasury.

effect: Players providing hides gain 1 gold.

ability: °EOA (end of age): gain 1 gold.

ability: °When closed, draw 1.

ability: °When opened: You may play an event as a free action.

ability: °When contracted, pay the contract from the treasury.  \n°Obsoleted by axes or swords.
effect: Players providing hides gain 1 gold.

name: Scribe
ability: °When opening a business, pay 1 less gold.
effect: Players providing hides gain 1 gold.

name: Seer

effect: Players providing hides gain 1 gold.

name: Shrine
ability: °When you play an event, gain 1 gold.
effect: Players providing the most science: draw a card and then you may discard a card.

name: Spear Maker
ability: °When contracted, pay the contract from the treasury.  \n°Obsoleted by swords.
effect: Players providing the most science: draw a card and then you may discard a card.

name: Inn
ability: °You may develop with one card per turn as a free action.
effect: Players providing the most science: draw a card and then you may discard a card.

name: Whaler
ability: °AAA (as an action): replace the bottom demand card with one in your hand.  \n°Obsoleted by swords.
effect: Treasury -1 gold for each demand card in excess of contracted weapons.

name: Quarry
ability: °No ability.
effect: Treasury -1 gold for each demand card in excess of contracted weapons.

name: School
ability: °AAA (as an action): swap the top card of the demand pile with a card in the event queue.
effect: Treasury -1 gold for each demand card in excess of contracted weapons.

name: Tower
ability: °EOA (end of age): pay this contract from the treasury.
effect: May play directly to demand pile.  \nIf there’s no other food in the demand pile, +1 population.

name: Arsenal
ability: °When contracted, pay the contract from the treasury.  \n°Obsoleted by swords.
effect: May play directly to demand pile.  \nIf there’s no other food in the demand pile, +1 population.

name: Tavern
ability: °EOA (end of age): If you provide more happiness than anyone, gain 2 gold.
effect: If contracted weapon count exceeds demand size: +1 population and treasury +4 gold.

name: Wheat Farm
ability: °You may play one event per turn as a free action.
effect: Players gain 1 gold per stone they provide.

name: Bank
ability: °When the treasury runs out, gain 2 gold.
effect: Players gain 1 gold per stone they provide.

name: Laboratory
ability: °Before playing an event, draw a card.  If it has science demand, reveal it and draw 1 more.
effect: Players gain 1 gold per stone they provide.

name: Academy
ability: °When drawing at the end of your turn, draw 2 then put one of them back.
effect: Pay all unpaid weapon contracts as you would at the End of Age.  They remain paid until End of Age.

name: Lodge
ability: °When opened, you may put the bottom demand card as a contract on any business.  \n°Obsoleted by swords.
effect: Players gain 1 gold per stone they provide.

name: Theater
ability: °AAA (as an action): gain 2 gold from here.  \n°When this is opened, place 10 gold on it.  When discarded, discard the gold.
effect: Players gain 1 gold per stone they provide.

name: Orchard
ability: °EOA (end of age): you may open businesses and take contracts (usual costs and restrictions apply).
effect: Pay all unpaid weapon contracts as you would at the End of Age.  They remain paid until End of Age.

name: Jeweler
ability: °EOA (end of age): if contracted, gain 1 gold per bronze provided by players.
effect: Players providing the most science: draw a card for each science you provide.  Return all but one to the bottom of its draw pile.

name: Lumberyard
ability: °When contracted, pay the contract from the treasury.  \n°Obsoletes clubs.
effect: Players providing the most science: draw a card for each science you provide.  Return all but one to the bottom of its draw pile.

name: Trade Post
ability: °When claiming a contract, you may treat one food provision on the business as any resource.
effect: Players providing the most science: draw a card for each science you provide.  Return all but one to the bottom of its draw pile.

name: Library
ability: °After starting a business, draw two cards then put one back.
effect: Treasury -1 gold for each demand or event card in excess of contracted weapons.

name: Smelter
ability: °When you play an event, examine it, then place it anywhere above the bottom event.  \n°Obsoletes clubs.
effect: Treasury -1 gold for each demand or event card in excess of contracted weapons.

name: Fort
ability: °To open, you must first close an opened stone business.  \n°Obsoletes clubs.
effect: Treasury -1 gold for each demand or event card in excess of contracted weapons.

name: Armory
ability: °When contracted, pay the contract from the treasury.  \n°Obsoletes clubs.
effect: If contracted weapon count exceeds demand card count: +1 population and treasury +6 gold.

name: Workshop
ability: °If you would draw a card at the end of your turn, draw 2 instead.
effect: If contracted weapon count exceeds demand card count: +1 population and treasury +6 gold.

name: Barber
ability: °EOA (end of age): gain 1 gold for each card in your hand.
effect: If contracted weapon count exceeds demand card count: +1 population and treasury +6 gold.

name: Dairy Farm
ability: °Starting a business is a free action.
effect: Players gain 1 gold per bronze they provide.

name: Insurance
ability: °When opened, place 10g here.  When the treasury runs out of money, pay 1 contract using this gold.
effect: Players gain 1 gold per bronze they provide.

name: Storeroom
ability: °Your draw limit is increased by 2.  \n°When opened, draw a card.
effect: Pay all unpaid weapon contracts as you would at the End of Age.  They remain paid until End of Age.

name: Bridge
ability: °When you close a business, you may start another one as a free action.
effect: Players gain 1 gold per bronze they provide.

name: Observatory
ability: °Each turn, you may peek at any face-down card.  If it’s a contract, you may swap it for one in your hand.
effect: Players gain 1 gold per bronze they provide.

name: Circus
ability: °When contracted, for each other opened business you have, gain 2 gold.
effect: Players gain 1 gold per bronze they provide.

name: Dock
ability: °When opened, place 5g here.  You may use this gold to open businesses.
effect: Pay all unpaid weapon contracts as you would at the End of Age.  They remain paid until End of Age.

name: Road
ability: °When opened, gain 1 gold for each type of resource you provide.
effect: Players providing the most science (not zero): you may contract any business using the top card of the discard pile.

name: Market
ability: °Each turn, you may reveal and discard 2 cards with the same demand to gain 5g.
effect: Each player gains 2 gold per science they provide.

name: Blacksmith
ability: °When contracted, pay the contract from the treasury.  \n°Obsoletes spears and clubs.
effect: Players providing the most science (not zero): Draw 2 cards from the discard pile.

name: Importer
ability: °When opened, add two cards of your choice from the discard pile to the demand pile.
effect: Treasury -2 gold for each demand card in excess of contracted weapons.

name: Villa
ability: °When opened, gain one action for every 2 food you provide (including this).  Passing has no effect this turn.
effect: Treasury -2 gold for each demand card in excess of contracted weapons.

name: Gravedigger
ability: °When opened, draw any two cards from the discard pile without looking at their faces.
effect: Treasury -2 gold for each demand card in excess of contracted weapons.

name: Iron Mine
ability: °No ability.
effect: Players gain 2 gold per food they provide.

name: Knighthood
ability: °When contracted, pay the contract from the treasury.  \n°Obsoletes spears and clubs.
effect: If contracted weapon count exceeds demand card count: +1 population and treasury +8g.

name: Temple
ability: °EOA (end of age): earn 2 gold from a player providing less happiness.
effect: If contracted weapon count exceeds demand card count: +1 population and treasury +8g.

name: Legion
ability: °When contracted, pay the contract from the treasury.  \n°Obsoletes spears and clubs.
effect: Players gain 2 gold per iron they provide.

name: Pawn Shop
ability: °When a hide, stone, or bronze is placed into the demand pile, gain 2 gold.
effect: Players gain 2 gold per iron they provide.

name: University
ability: °When opened, return the development cards to your hand.
effect: Open, uncontracted businesses earn their owners 2 gold each.

name: Scriptorium
ability: °On your turn, you may turn the bottom demand card face-down.\n°Treat any one happiness demand as any resource.
effect: Deal the top two cards from the discard pile onto the demand pile.

name: Cafe
ability: °Take an extra turn after the turn in which you opened this.
effect: Treasury +2 gold for each happiness in demand.

name: Arena
ability: °Each turn, gain 1 gold.  \n°Obsoletes spears and clubs.
effect: Treasury +5 gold.

name: Museum
ability: °When drawing at the end of your turn, you may draw from the discard pile.
effect: Pay all unpaid weapon contracts as you would at the End of Age.  They remain paid until End of Age.
